title: More later
author: JGray
text:
This is the last page of the storyline and I want to say something insightful and interesting.

But I'm to exhausted. So, I'll try again tomorrow.

replies.author: j*Guest*
replies.text: If it makes you feel better it looks really really cool

replies.author: Ayra*Guest*
replies.text: Not only is the world flat, but it is turtle-shaped? Well, at least that world is So we won't get epic cloak taming? Ah well...

replies.author: shikomekidomi*Guest*
replies.text:
Actually zooming out farther and farther after a character is abandoned and collapses alone is a nice effective dramatic technique that reinforces feelings of alienation and separation, particularly when we don't see other people.
It would have been a lot better if she'd been faintly visible in the first panel instead of zooming out too far for that, though.

replies.author: NL*Guest*
replies.text: Bex I was thinking the exact same thing.

replies.author: Dalrint*Guest*
replies.text: Turtles all the way down out

replies.author: Johan*Guest*
replies.text: Reminds me of Kiel from Drowtales : �Let me explain the universe I live in. Everything, the whole of the 3 worlds are upon a turtle. And that turtle is on a turtle. That turtle is on another turtle, and so forth all the way down to infinity.� And I think the joke comes from something Stephen Hawkins wrote � can�t remember it.  Anyway, what is the deal with turtles and infinity? Despite it being infinitely hilarious?And that another great chapter by the way. It�s good Chrys didn�t get shoot ^^
